quotes.message: Wisdom is wealth.
quotes.name: Swahili

quotes.message: Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.
quotes.name: Akan proverb

quotes.message: The fool speaks, the wise man listens.
quotes.name: Ethiopian proverb

quotes.message: Wisdom does not come overnight.
quotes.name: Cameroon proverb

quotes.message: Wisdom is like fire. People take it from others.
quotes.name: Hema (DRC) proverb

quotes.message: Only a wise person can solve a difficult problem.
quotes.name: Akan proverb

quotes.message: Knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand.
quotes.name: Guinean proverb

quotes.message: In the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges, and the foolish build dams.
quotes.name: Nigerian proverb

quotes.message: If you are filled with pride, then you will have no room for wisdom.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: A wise person will always find a way.
quotes.name: Tanzanian proverb

quotes.message: Nobody is born wise.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
quotes.name: Kenyan proverb

quotes.message: Wisdom is not like money to be tied up and hidden.
quotes.name: Akan proverb

quotes.message: Learning expands great souls.
quotes.name: Namibian proverb

quotes.message: To get lost is to learn the way.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: By crawling a child learns to stand.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: If you close your eyes to facts, you will learn through accidents.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: who learns, teaches.
quotes.name: Ethiopian proverb

quotes.message: Wealth, if you use it, comes to an end; learning, if you use it, increases.
quotes.name: Swahili proverb

quotes.message: By trying often, the monkey learns to jump from the tree.
quotes.name: Buganda proverb

quotes.message: You always learn a lot more when you lose than when you win.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: You learn how to cut down trees by cutting them down.
quotes.name: Bateke proverb

quotes.message: The wise create proverbs for fools to learn, not to repeat.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: What you help a child to love can be more important than what you help him to learn.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: By the time the fool has learned the game, the players have dispersed.
quotes.name: Ashanti proverb

quotes.message: One who causes others misfortune also teaches them wisdom.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: The fool speaks, the wise man listens.
quotes.name: Ethiopian proverb

quotes.message: You do not teach the paths of the forest to an old gorilla.
quotes.name: Congolese proverb

quotes.message: What you learn is what you die with.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Instruction in youth is like engraving in stone.
quotes.name: Moroccan Proverb

quotes.message: When you follow in the path of your father, you learn to walk like him.
quotes.name: Ashanti Proverb

quotes.message: Ears that do not listen to advice, accompany the head when it is chopped off.
quotes.name: African Proverb

quotes.message: Advice is a stranger; if he’s welcome he stays for the night; if not, he leaves the same day.
quotes.name: Malagasy Proverb

quotes.message: Traveling is learning.
quotes.name: Kenyan Proverb

quotes.message: Where there are experts there will be no lack of learners.
quotes.name: Swahili Proverb

quotes.message: Peace is costly but it is worth the expense.
quotes.name: Kenyan proverb

quotes.message: War has no eyes.
quotes.name: Swahili Proverb

quotes.message: When a king has good counselors, his reign is peaceful.
quotes.name: Ashanti proverb

quotes.message: Peace does not make a good ruler.
quotes.name: Botswana proverb

quotes.message: A fight between grasshoppers is a joy to the crow.
quotes.name: Lesotho Proverb

quotes.message: Milk and honey have different colors, but they share the same house peacefully.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: If you can’t resolve your problems in peace, you can’t solve war.
quotes.name: Somalian proverb

quotes.message: When there is peace in the country, the chief does not carry a shield.
quotes.name: Ugandan proverb

quotes.message: When two elephants fight, it is the grass that gets trampled.
quotes.name: Swahili saying

quotes.message: Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.
quotes.name: West African proverb

quotes.message: He who thinks he is leading and has no one following him is only taking a walk.
quotes.name: Malawian proverb

quotes.message: An army of sheep led by a lion can defeat an army of lions led by a sheep.
quotes.name: Ghanaian proverb

quotes.message: He who is destined for power does not have to fight for it.
quotes.name: Ugandan proverb

quotes.message: Do not forget what is to be a sailor because of being a captain yourself.
quotes.name: Tanzanian Proverb

quotes.message: Without a leader, black ants are confused.
quotes.name: Ugandan proverb

quotes.message: He who refuses to obey cannot command.
quotes.name: Kenyan proverb

quotes.message: He who fears the sun will not become chief.
quotes.name: Ugandan proverb

quotes.message: A large chair does not make a king.
quotes.name: Sudanese proverb

quotes.message: Because he lost his reputation, he lost a kingdom.
quotes.name: Ethiopian proverb

quotes.message: Where a woman rules, streams run uphill.
quotes.name: Ethiopian proverb

quotes.message: A leader who does not take advice is not a leader.
quotes.name: Kenyan proverb

quotes.message: If the cockroach wants to rule over the chicken, then it must hire the fox as a body-guard.
quotes.name: Sierra Leone proverb

quotes.message: Unity is strength, the division is weakness.
quotes.name: Swahili proverb

quotes.message: Sticks in a bundle are unbreakable.
quotes.name: Bondei proverb

quotes.message: It takes a village to raise a child.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Cross the river in a crowd and the crocodile won’t eat you.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Many hands make light work.
quotes.name: Haya (Tanzania) proverb

quotes.message: Where there are many, nothing goes wrong.
quotes.name: Swahili proverb

quotes.message: Two ants do not fail to pull one grasshopper.
quotes.name: Tanzanian proverb

quotes.message: A single bracelet does not jingle.
quotes.name: Congolese proverb

quotes.message: A single stick may smoke, but it will not burn.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: If you want to go quickly, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: A family is like a forest when you are outside it is dense, when you are inside you see that each tree has its place.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: A united family eats from the same plate.
quotes.name: Baganda proverb

quotes.message: A family tie is like a tree, it can bend but it cannot break.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: If I am in harmony with my family, that’s a success.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Brothers love each other when they are equally rich.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Dine with a stranger but save your love for your family.
quotes.name: Ethiopian proverb

quotes.message: The old woman looks after the child to grow its teeth and the young one, in turn, looks after the old woman when she loses her teeth.
quotes.name: Akan (Ghana, Ivory Coast) proverb

quotes.message: There is no fool who is disowned by his family.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Home affairs are not talked about in the public square.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: If relatives help each other, what evil can hurt them?.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: When brothers fight to the death, a stranger inherits their father’s estate.
quotes.name: Ibo proverb

quotes.message: He who earns calamity eats it with his family.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Children are the reward of life.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: To be without a friend is to be poor indeed.
quotes.name: Tanzanian proverb

quotes.message: Hold a true friend with both hands.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: The friends of our friends are our friends.
quotes.name: Congolese proverb

quotes.message: A friend is someone you share the path with.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Show me your friend and I will show you your character.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Return to old watering holes for more than water; friends and dreams are there to meet you.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: Between true friends, even water drunk together is sweet enough.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: A small house will hold a hundred friends.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: A close friend can become a close enemy.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: . Bad friends will prevent you from having good friends.
quotes.name: Gabon proverb

quotes.message: Make some money but don’t let money make you.
quotes.name: Tanzania proverb

quotes.message: It is no shame at all to work for money.
quotes.name: African proverb

quotes.message: He who loves money must labor.
quotes.name: Mauritania proverb

quotes.message: By labor comes wealth.
quotes.name: Yoruba proverb

quotes.message: Poverty is slavery.
quotes.name: Somalia proverb

quotes.message: One cannot both feast and become rich.
quotes.name: AShanti proverb

quotes.message: One cannot count on riches.
quotes.name: Somalia proverb

quotes.message: Money is sharper than the sword.
quotes.name: Ashanti proverb

quotes.message: A man’s wealth may be superior to him.
quotes.name: Cameroon proverb

quotes.message: The rich are always complaining.
quotes.name: Zulu proverb

quotes.message: The wealth which enslaves the owner isn’t wealth.
quotes.name: Yoruba proverb

quotes.message: The poor man and the rich man do not play together.
quotes.name: Ashanti proverb

quotes.message: Lack of money is a lack of friends; if you have money at your disposal, every dog and goat will claim to be related to you.
quotes.name: Yoruba proverb

quotes.message: With wealth one wins a woman.
quotes.name: Uganda proverb

quotes.message: Dogs do not actually prefer bones to meat; it is just that no one ever gives them meat.
quotes.name: Akan proverb

quotes.message: A real family eats the same cornmeal.
quotes.name: Bayombe proverb

quotes.message: Money can’t talk, yet it can make lies look true.
quotes.name: South African proverb

quotes.message: If your cornfield is far from your house, the birds will eat your corn.
quotes.name: Congo proverb

quotes.message: You become wise when you begin to run out of money.
quotes.name: Ghana proverb

quotes.message: If heaven made him, earth can find some use for him.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: He who strikes the first blow admits he's lost the argument.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: Not only can water float a boat, it can sink it also.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: If you don't want anyone to know, don't do it.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: He who is drowned is not troubled by the rain.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: When the tree falls, the monkeys scatter.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: Do not fear going forward slowly; fear only to stand still.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: If heaven made him, earth can find some use for him.
quotes.name: Hong Kong Proverb

quotes.message: If you plant grass, you won't get rice.
quotes.name: Singapore Proverb

quotes.message: Those who speak aloud are boastful. Those who speak softly are unsure. Those who don’t speak are dangerous
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: Keep a snake, and the snake will eat your chicken.
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: A given excuse that was not asked for implies guilt..
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: Not all stones are blessed to become diamonds.
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: Better poverty before wealth than poverty after wealth.
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: You don't need to teach a young crocodile to swim.
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: On a big tree, there are dead branches; in a big clan, there are beggars.
quotes.name: Singaporean Proverb

quotes.message: It takes sweat to work on things, but it only takes saliva to criticize things.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: Man who wants pretty nurse, must be patient.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: A fool judges people by the presents they give him.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: As long as you have the forest, you don't have to worry about firewood.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: Man who lives in glass house should change clothes in basement.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: Be not afraid of growing slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: Something that looks good does not necessarily taste good.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: He who asks is a fool for five minutes, but he who does not ask remains a fool forever.
quotes.name: Taiwanese Proverb

quotes.message: Dawn will come with or without the cock.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: Rich is he who has no debts, fortunate he who lives without handicap.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: Suffer in liberty than delight in captivity.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: There are men who walk through the woods and see no trees.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: If you fear it, do not do it. If you do it, do not fear it.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: If you are going to steal bells plug your ears.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: The distance between heaven and earth is no greater than one thought.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: Be the head of a wasp than the tail of a lion.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: The more you listen the more you give yourself room for doubt.
quotes.name: Mongolian Proverb

quotes.message: Each generation will reap what the former generation has sown.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: Do not confine your children to your own learning, for they were born in another time.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: There are two perfectly good men, one dead, and the other unborn.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: With true friends... even water drunk together is sweet enough.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: If you suspect a man, don't employ him, and if you employ him, don't suspect him.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: Deep doubts, deep wisdom; small doubts, little wisdom.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: Clear conscience never fears midnight knocking.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: A wise man makes his own decisions, an ignorant man follows the public opinion.
quotes.name: Macaunese Proverb

quotes.message: A coconut shell full of water is a sea to an ant.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: when anger comes, does wisdom go.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: What does a monkey know of the taste of ginger?.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: You have to believe in gods to see them.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: When a woman laughs an experienced man will know how much it will cost him.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: Call on God, but row away from the rocks.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: In love beggar and king are equal.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: The ambitious one makes friends with the elephant, then tramples upon the ant.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: The enemy's own punishment is his envy.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: Follow the river and you will get to the sea.
quotes.name: Indian Proverb

quotes.message: Due to the presence of fools wise people stand out.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: A bad wife spells a hundred years of bad harvest.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: When the character of a man is not clear to you, look at his friends.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: Nothing is more expensive than free.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: One kind word can warm three winter months.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: Good medicine tastes bitter.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: If you fall down seven times, get up eight.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: The frog in the well knows not of the great ocean.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: Even monkeys fall from trees.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: Unless an idiot dies, he won't be cured.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: Even a fool has one talent.
quotes.name: Japanese Proverb

quotes.message: A great river does not refuse any small streams.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: Even if the sky falls on you, there is a hole that you can escape from.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: Cast no dirt into the well that gives you water.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: You will hate a beautiful song if you sing it often.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: When you have three daughters, you sleep with the door open.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: To be prepared is to have no anxiety.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: Even if you encounter a stone bridge, tap it first before crossing.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: Virginity can be lost in one night.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: Even though words have no wings, they can still fly a thousand miles.
quotes.name: South Korean Proverb

quotes.message: He who seeks vengeance must dig two graves: one for his enemy and one for himself.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Reading ten thousand books is not as useful as traveling ten thousand miles.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Clear conscience never fears midnight knocking.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: One generation plants the trees, and another gets the shade.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: He who sacrifices his conscience to ambition burns a picture to obtain the ashes.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: f you want happiness for a lifetime; help someone else.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Politeness wins the confidence of princes.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Fear the living not the dead.
quotes.name: Filipino Proverb

quotes.message: The monkey may be intelligent, but can be outsmarted.
quotes.name: Filipino Proverb

quotes.message: A careless person will be taken by surprise by his observant enemy.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: In every generation there are some outstanding chiefs.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: It is useless to shake the branch that bears no fruit.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: A careless person will be taken by surprise by his observant enemy.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: The person with burnt fingers asks for tongs.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: If at first you don't suceed try, try and try again.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: Stones rot but not words.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: The skate swims away, but leaves its barb.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: Obey like a canoe before the wind.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: Who sits at home in the morning will not eat in the evening.
quotes.name: Amerian Samoa Proverb

quotes.message: Don’t salute with a hat that doesn’t belong to you.

quotes.message: Don’t salute with a hat that doesn’t belong to you.
quotes.name: Guamanian Proverb

quotes.message: The more you talk the more you lie.

quotes.message: It is better to ask for something and be refused it, than to give and not have it appreciated.
quotes.name: Guamanian Proverb

quotes.message: He who provokes a war must be sure that he knows how to fight.
quotes.name: Tongan Proverb

quotes.message: Friendship is a furrow in the sand.

quotes.message: The hyena does not forget where it has hidden its kill.
quotes.name: Tongan Proverb

quotes.message: The white man has no kin. his kin is his money.
quotes.name: Tongan Proverb

quotes.message: Each bay, its own wind.
quotes.name: Fijian Proverb

quotes.message: Idleness is to be dead at the limbs but alive within.
quotes.name: Fijian Proverb

quotes.message: Life is like this: sometimes sun, sometimes rain.

quotes.message: All knowledge are not taught in one school.
quotes.name: Hawaiian Proverb

quotes.message: The Lehua blossom unfolds when the rains tread on it.

quotes.message: Love is a spring that flow freely.
quotes.name: Hawaiian Proverb

quotes.message: No task is too big when done together.
quotes.name: Hawaiian Proverb

quotes.message: A fisherman of shallow seas uses only a short line; a fisherman of the deep sea uses a long line.

quotes.message: Keep your eyes on the sun and you will not see the shadows.

quotes.message: Being different is easy. Doing something better than others is hard.

quotes.message: One good turn deserves another.

quotes.message: Those who play bowls must look out for rubbers.
quotes.name: Australian Proverb

quotes.message: The more you know, the less you need.
quotes.name: Australian Proverb

quotes.message: The kumara never talks about how sweet it is.
quotes.name: New Zealander Proverb

quotes.message: It is woman and land that chiefly destroy men.

quotes.message: Old canoes can be restored, but youth and beauty cannot.

quotes.message: A full stomach causes a bird to sing, a man to laugh.

quotes.message: Boast during the day; be humble at night.

quotes.message: Only the foolish visit the land of the cannibals.

quotes.message: He who battles under the native skies gains the lion’s courage.

quotes.message: If you are afraid of love then you are afraid of life.

quotes.message: A coward is afraid of his own shadow.

quotes.message: A weak man has a long tongue.

quotes.message: He, who does not live for others, does not live for himself.

quotes.message: On the marriage of your son seek the advice of a dozen, on a divorce – of a hundred.

quotes.message: A mother’s anger is like snow: there is much of it but it melts quickly.

quotes.message: Who does not value a kopeck takes no care of a ruble.

quotes.message: Men look for a beautiful woman, a homely one looks for a husband herself.
quotes.name: Abkhaz Proverb

quotes.message: If the neighbours are good ones, even a blind girl will get married.

quotes.message: It’s better to be a poor man in your homeland than a king in Cairo.

quotes.message: Your friend is your mirror.

quotes.message: If you’re a friend to everyone – that means to no one.

quotes.message: What is hidden in heart is reflected on face.

quotes.message: Do a kind deed and throw it into the water – it won’t be lost.

quotes.message: One who grows a forest never destroys it.

quotes.message: If you want to test a friend – look at him in anger.

quotes.message: Advice is a free gift that can become expensive for the one who gets it.
quotes.name: Armenia Proverb

quotes.message: The woman who loves her husband corrects his faults; the man that loves his wife exaggerates them.

quotes.message: When the thief has stolen from a thief, God laughs in heaven.

quotes.message: Who drinks till bottom, lives without mind.

quotes.message: Advice is a free gift that can become expensive for the one who gets it.

quotes.message: When you live next to the cemetery you cannot weep for everyone..

quotes.message: Fear the law not the judge

quotes.message: Who talks little hears better

quotes.message: ell me who your friends are, so I can tell you who you are.

quotes.message: A tree falls the way it leans
quotes.name: Bulgarian Proverb

quotes.message: You can guess the day by the evening.

quotes.message: Where shepherds are many, sheeps are lost.

quotes.message: If it were ever to rain soup, the poor would only have forks.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: Others will measure you with the same rod you use to measure them.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: If God does not grant you glory, be content with fame.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: Where blood has been shed the tree of forgiveness cannot grow.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: Poverty is not a crime, but it's better not to show it.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: Haste is the mother of imperfection.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: Love is blind, so you have to feel your way.
quotes.name: Brazilian Proverb

quotes.message: He who hears no advice will not reach old age.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: Pay what you owe and you will know what you are worth.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: Alcohol preserves all, except employment
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: He who says what he likes will hear what he does not like.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: In union there is strength.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: The shrimp that falls asleep gets carried away by the current.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: Never be deterred by the closing of one door.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: The most desirable woman is always the one who belongs to someone else.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: In youth we learn, in old age we understand.
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: Love sickness hurts but does not kill
quotes.name: Ecuadorian Proverb

quotes.message: Rare is the person who can weigh faults of another without putting his thumb on the scale.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Be grateful with what you have rather than what you think might be out there.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: If you think the worst, you won't be far wrong.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Whom the gods love die young.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Gratitude ranks as the least of virtues, and the lack of gratitude is the worst of vices.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: With money anything is possible
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Nothing goes on for ever.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Revenge is a dish which is served cold.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: A hatchet in the mouth is more harmful than a hatchet in the hand.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Don't over stay your welcome.
quotes.name: Paraguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Don't take every illness to the doctor, or every quarrel to the lawyer, or every thirst to the tavern.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Clear accounts make for long friendships.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Time will give you the best disguise.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: The early bird God helps.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: That which is done at night appears in the day.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: In time of war, any hole is trench.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Better to lose a minute in your life than your life in a minute.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: The favor of a man in power is like a summer shower.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb

quotes.message: Gifts break rocks and melt hearts.
quotes.name: Uruguayan Proverb
